questions.question: What is a smart contract in the context of blockchain?

answers.a: A self-executing program that runs automatically when predefined conditions are met
answers.b: A physical document signed by users
answers.d: A manually executed agreement between parties

questions.question: Which feature of smart contracts ensures that their rules cannot be changed after deployment?
How do smart contracts receive real-world data to execute actions?

answers.a: Through oracles that provide external data to the blockchain
answers.b: By manually entering information in the blockchain ledger
answers.d: By storing physical records in a secure vault

questions.question: Why are smart contracts considered efficient?

answers.a: They reduce manual intervention and automatically enforce rules
answers.b: They generate physical products without human work
answers.c: They replace all legal processes entirely
answers.d: They work without any digital records

questions.question: Which step involves coding the agreed-upon rules of a smart contract?

answers.a: Step 2: Writing the contract code using a programming language like Solidity
answers.b: Step 1: Deciding the rules with all parties
answers.c: Step 4: Deploying the contract to the blockchain
answers.d: Step 5: Waiting for a trigger to execute the contract

questions.question: What happens when the conditions of a smart contract are met?

answers.a: The contract executes automatically, and results are recorded on the blockchain
answers.b: The parties must manually approve each action
answers.c: The blockchain is updated only after a physical audit
answers.d: Nothing happens until a government authority intervenes

questions.question: Why are smart contracts considered trustworthy?

answers.a: Because all transactions are transparent and immutable on the blockchain
answers.b: Because they rely on a central authority to approve each step
answers.c: Because they allow parties to edit results after execution
answers.d: Because they do not store any data digitally
